entry.title: The Single Point of Failure: Analyzing the Latest AWS Outage
entry.summary: The recent, multi-hour outage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) on Monday, October 20, 2025, served as a stark and costly reminder of how profoundly the global digital economy relies on a few core infrastructure providers. What began as a technical issue in a single US region—specifically, the crucial US-EAST-1 data center in Virginia—quickly cascaded into… The post The Single Point of Failure: Analyzing the Latest AWS Outage appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: Emily Ring recognized as Oregon's Emergency Manager Professional of the Year
entry.summary: When the March 2025 floods hit Douglas County, the community found itself scrambling for recovery resources, as well as a strategy for repairing the nearly $5.2 million in damages to county operated roads.

entry.title: VFW Post 2468 holds ceremony for US submarine remembrance wall
entry.summary: Since the founding of the U.S. Navy Submarine Force in 1900, 66 submarines have been lost in service to both combat and non-combat related causes. A combined 3,891 U.S. Navy sailors lost their lives, never returning from the depths they…

entry.title: Petition requests U.S. Fish and Wildlife to list Umpqua chub, northern roach on endangered list
entry.summary: The Center for Biological Diversity sent a petition to the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service on Thursday Sking for protection for two fish species in Oregon and California under the Endangered Species Act.

entry.summary: October 21, 2025 2:50 a.m. On Monday, the Oregon Department of Human Services notified approximately 757,000 Oregonians who receive food assistance through the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program that they will not receive new benefits after October 31st because of the federal government shutdown. entry.title: Teen Released After Allegedly Bringing Gun to Yoncalla High School
entry.summary: An 18-year-old Yoncalla student was arrested after allegedly bringing a gun to school earlier this month. Taylor Haydon Larson was released on the condition he stay away from campus. He faces two weapons charges after a video showing a pistol in a school bathroom led to his arrest.

entry.title: Costumes and canines: Saving Grace Humane Society to hold Pints for Pits charity event
entry.summary: There are arguably few pets that are as divisive as pit bulls. While many find the breed to be lovable, loyal and sweet, others hold the view of them being aggressive and dangerous.

entry.title: Riddle Mayor Bill Duckett resigns after decades of service
entry.summary: RIDDLE — On Jan. 9, 1995, Bill Duckett officially became the mayor of Riddle. For the next 30 years, he helped spearhead projects and tackle issues that presented themselves for his community.

entry.title: The Roseburg Receiver Helps Bring New GMRS Repeater and Regional Safety Upgrades to Douglas County
entry.summary: The Roseburg Receiver is partnering with local radio operators to launch a new GMRS repeater on Mount Nebo, expanding emergency communication across Douglas County. This project will bring together repeaters across southern Oregon, keeping communities connected when other systems fail.
